str2: A primary particle; but, and, etc.
Paul, Paulus. Of Latin origin; Paulus, the name of a Roman and of an apostle.

parse: Verb - Imperfect Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To say, declare. Properly, the same as the base of phos and phaino; to show or make known one's thoughts, i.e. Speak or say.
To, towards, with. A strengthened form of pro; a preposition of direction; forward to, i.e. Toward.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To flay, flog, scourge, beat. A primary verb; properly, to flay, i.e. to scourge, or to thrash.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Plural
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.
Public, publicly. From demos; public; in public.
Uncondemned, not yet tried. Without trial.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: (a) I cast, throw, rush, (b) often, in the weaker sense: I place, put, drop. A primary verb; to throw.
A primary preposition; to or into, of place, time, or purpose; also in adverbial phrases.
From phulasso; a guarding or, the act, the person; figuratively, the place, the condition, or, the time, literally or figuratively.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Plural
str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).
Roman; subst: a Roman citizen. From Rhome; Romaean, i.e. Roman.
And, even, also, namely.
A primary particle of present time; 'now'; also as noun or adjective present or immediate.

word: do they want to send us away
parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To throw (cast, put) out; I banish; I bring forth, produce. From ek and ballo; to eject.
Secretly, privately. Adverb from lanthano; privately.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural
str2: To come, go.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Nominative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Verb - Aorist Imperative Active - 3rd Person Plural
str2: To lead out, sometimes to death, execution. From ek and ago; to lead forth.
